summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene and aldehydes are both identified as harmful compounds generated during high-temperature cooking processes. The text highlights that various carcinogens, including Buta-1,3-diene and several aldehydes like acetaldehyde, are released in cooking fumes, linking them to potential cancer risks. This suggests a shared relevance in the context of cooking-related carcinogenic exposure.
